content.description: About 18 feet off the deck, there's a bit of a reach. Really fun and consistent with awesome holds every so often.
content.protection: Standard rack, emphasis on small gear. Use the thread up top for an anchor.
content.location: Second consistent crack from the left. Needs to either be rapped into or walk around and down to the west.

content.description: These are the two cracks about 1.5 ft. from eachother. First crux is at the bottom, second was just before you reach the top. Fun movement on shallow flaring parallel cracks. Rock looks a bit loose but is more solid than you'd think.
content.protection: Lots of small cams and nuts. C3 00-2, C4 .3-.75. Small gear for the anchor.
content.location: Forth and fifth cracks from the left. lower off your anchor or walk around the west (left) side. There is currently a cactus at the base (currently...).

content.description: Crux is getting past the bush, but it won't be there for long. Bad is that there is a lot of loose rock toward the top, I suggest staying on the face.
content.protection: small to medium gear. Small gear for the anchor. Same spot as Tracks crack.
content.location: Sixth consistent crack from the left. Left of the parallel cracks. Currently the start has some shrubbery.

content.description: The first fifteen feet is the crux. The good is it is fun climbing with easy placement. It is a bit on the short side.
content.protection: two #3, and one #4 camalots. Small gear for the top anchor c3 00-1 and .3, .4.
content.location: When coming down from the power line, if you stick to the lower angle rocky ridge then go between the two juniper trees, scramble down a little more to the left after reaching a cliff you will see this to your left.

content.description: Moving onto the face might be the crux. Fun and easy, mostly a solo.
content.location: Down and on the far east side of rail road crossing.

content.description: Climb the obvious lightning crack through the entire face. Crux is maybe passing the horizontal crack. Solid climbing with plenty of gear. Still some loose rock up there so be careful.
content.protection: Mainly cams, nuts to supplement. Top anchor can be a bit tricky, may need to do a quick short pitch.
content.location: Route is down from the main wall and directly below Low Velocity Locomotive. bottom left of the wall. Walk off or belay second up to top. Can also be top roped but you'll need to set up your own anchor. You cannot see this from the main wall walk east and it is facing east below you.

content.description: The first 20 feet or so is the crux, and pro is very limited. Fun though.
content.protection: Mostly small stuff c3's and what not. There is a thread and a #3 placement on top of the crack to the right.
content.location: Left most crack that runs up and down all the way. Lower off or walk around to the west.
